DataElement.preferredName: Dental Pulp Exposure Hemorrhage Control Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin. It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions. Contact with infectious agents (bacteria or viruses) in a manner that promotes transmission and increases the likelihood of disease. Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel. The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another. The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
